result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Expires: 12/12/22.

Defendant Jawanza Alfonzo Williams not in court, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court for Jawanza Alfonzo Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a jury trial. State is prepared to proceed. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an adjournment. State does not object. Court sets matter for a final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Jawanza Alfonzo Williams not in court, in custody.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 9/12/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Jawanza A. Williams - #2022004549, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Demand for a Speedy Trial.  (Jawanza A. Williams - #2022004549, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Jawanza Alfonzo Williams not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 29
Defendant Jawanza Alfonzo Williams in court, appear by video with attorney Russell J. A. Jones, appear by video.  Defendant Jawanza Alfonzo Williams in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judical Notice to United State Case 15CR21713871-0849 Sworn for the State: Detective M. Dukic.  Stipulation to the identification agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jawanza Alfonzo Williams not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a State v. Lee hearing. Attorney Russ Jones present in court and will accept PD appointment of this case. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 29
Defendant Jawanza Alfonzo Williams not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Jawanza A. Williams - #2022004549, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

10:56 AM Defendant Jawanza Alfonzo Williams not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Kenya LaJoy Q. or anyone in her family;  Pearlee P..; Debra A.; DM (male child); KW (female child); KW (male child)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jawanza Alfonzo Williams in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Jawanza Alfonzo Williams in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jawanza Alfonzo Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 5, 7 and 9. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
